body:
## **Frontend Release 7: Add `group-by:quarter`**

Follow the same pattern as [Release 3 - Add group-by:tag](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/80394) but for `group-by:quarter`.

Add the ability to Group By Quarter from Reports > Expenses (`group-by:quarter`) without a suggested search.

title: [$250] [Insights] [Release 3] Add group-by:tag

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
## **Frontend Release 3: Add `group-by:tag`**

Implement the same pattern as other group-by options (from, card, category, merchant), but without a suggested search.

1. Add the ability to Group By Tag from Reports > Expenses (`group-by:tag`)
   1. Follow the pattern used for `group-by:from` in Top Spenders.
   2. [src/CONST/index.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/CONST/index.ts#L6827-L6831) - Add `TAG: 'tag'` to `CONST.SEARCH.GROUP_BY`
   3. [src/languages/en.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/languages/en.ts#L6771-L6775) (and all language files) - Add `[CONST.SEARCH.GROUP_BY.TAG]: 'Tag'` to `search.filters.groupBy`

2. Add "Tag" to Group Columns on Search Columns Page (follow the same pattern as existing group columns: FROM, CARD, WITHDRAWAL_ID, CATEGORY, MERCHANT)
   1. Define the GROUP_TAG table column constant in the TABLE_COLUMNS object - [src/CONST/index.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/CONST/index.ts#L7012-L7014)
   2. Add a TAG entry to GROUP_CUSTOM_COLUMNS to define which group columns are available when grouping by tag. Include tag, expenses, total - [src/CONST/index.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/CONST/index.ts#L6858-L6878)
   3. Add a TAG entry to GROUP_DEFAULT_COLUMNS that specifies the default columns to show when grouping by tag - [src/CONST/index.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/CONST/index.ts#L6908-L6919)
   4. Add a user friendly name mapping for the GROUP_TAG column - [src/CONST/index.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/CONST/index.ts#L7180-L7194)
   5. Handle the TAG case in `getCustomColumns()` to return the tag custom columns - [src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L2578-L2600)
   6. Handle the TAG case in `getCustomColumnDefault()` to return the default tag columns - [src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L2603-L2626)
   7. Add TAG mappings to both the `customColumns` and `defaultCustomColumns` objects in `getColumnsToShow()` - [src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L3159-L3170)
   8. Add a conditional check in `getColumnsToShow()` to ensure required columns (AVATAR and GROUP_TAG) are always included when grouping by tag - [src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L3209-L3224)
   9. Add a case for GROUP_TAG in `getSearchColumnTranslationKey()` that returns the tag translation key - [src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L2628-L2708)
   10. Add GROUP_TAG to the required columns set so it cannot be hidden on the Search Columns Page - [src/pages/Search/SearchColumnsPage.tsx](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/pages/Search/SearchColumnsPage.tsx#L58-L64)
   11. Add a case for TAG in `getTransactionGroupHeaders()` that returns the appropriate column header configuration - [src/components/SelectionListWithSections/SearchTableHeader.tsx](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/components/SelectionListWithSections/SearchTableHeader.tsx#L263-L310)
   12. Update the SearchCustomColumnIds type to include the tag custom column values - [src/components/Search/types.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/components/Search/types.ts#L117-L122)

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @suneox</details>

title: [$250] [Insights] [Release 2] Top Merchants - Add group-by:merchant and suggested search

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
## **Frontend Release 2: Add "Top Merchants" suggested search**

Follow the same pattern as "Top Spenders" and "Top Categories"

1. Add the ability to Group By Merchant from Reports > Expenses (`group-by:merchant`)
   1. Follow the pattern used for `group-by:from` in Top Spenders.
   2. [src/CONST/index.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/CONST/index.ts#L6827-L6831) - Add `MERCHANT: 'merchant'` to `CONST.SEARCH.GROUP_BY`
   3. [src/languages/en.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/languages/en.ts#L6771-L6775) (and all language files) - Add `[CONST.SEARCH.GROUP_BY.MERCHANT]: 'Merchant'` to `search.filters.groupBy`

2. Add a Top Merchants suggested search to all accounts with a workspace
   1. [src/CONST/index.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/CONST/index.ts#L7251-L7264) - Add `TOP_MERCHANTS: 'topMerchants'` to `CONST.SEARCH.SEARCH_KEYS`
   2. [src/languages/en.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/languages/en.ts#L6710) (and all language files) - Add `topMerchants: 'Top merchants'` translation
   3. [src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L607-L628) - Add `TOP_MERCHANTS` definition in `getSuggestedSearches()` with query: `type:expense group-by:merchant date:last-month sort-by:group-total sort-order:desc limit:10`
   4. [src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L640-L729) - Add visibility logic in `getSuggestedSearchesVisibility()` to show for all accounts with at least one workspace (policy)
   5. [src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/9c1b8c3bb077c0cc934a9dac304141a5137334b6/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L2934-L2944) - Add to Insights menu section in `createTypeMenuSections()`

3. Add "Merchant" to Group Columns on Search Columns Page (follow the same pattern as existing group columns: FROM, CARD, WITHDRAWAL_ID, CATEGORY)
   1. Define the GROUP_MERCHANT table column constant in the TABLE_COLUMNS object - [src/CONST/index.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/CONST/index.ts#L7012-L7014)
   2. Add a MERCHANT entry to GROUP_CUSTOM_COLUMNS to define which group columns are available when grouping by merchant. Include merchant, expenses, total - [src/CONST/index.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/CONST/index.ts#L6858-L6878)
   3. Add a MERCHANT entry to GROUP_DEFAULT_COLUMNS that specifies the default columns to show when grouping by merchant - [src/CONST/index.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/CONST/index.ts#L6908-L6919)
   4. Add a user friendly name mapping for the GROUP_MERCHANT column - [src/CONST/index.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/CONST/index.ts#L7180-L7194)
   5. Handle the MERCHANT case in `getCustomColumns()` to return the merchant custom columns - [src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L2578-L2600)
   6. Handle the MERCHANT case in `getCustomColumnDefault()` to return the default merchant columns - [src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L2603-L2626)
   7. Add MERCHANT mappings to both the `customColumns` and `defaultCustomColumns` objects in `getColumnsToShow()` - [src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L3159-L3170)
   8. Add a conditional check in `getColumnsToShow()` to ensure required columns (AVATAR and GROUP_MERCHANT) are always included when grouping by merchant - [src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L3209-L3224)
   9. Add a case for GROUP_MERCHANT in `getSearchColumnTranslationKey()` that returns the merchant translation key - [src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/libs/SearchUIUtils.ts#L2628-L2708)
   10. Add GROUP_MERCHANT to the required columns set so it cannot be hidden on the Search Columns Page - [src/pages/Search/SearchColumnsPage.tsx](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/pages/Search/SearchColumnsPage.tsx#L58-L64)
   11. Add a case for MERCHANT in `getTransactionGroupHeaders()` that returns the appropriate column header configuration - [src/components/SelectionListWithSections/SearchTableHeader.tsx](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/components/SelectionListWithSections/SearchTableHeader.tsx#L263-L310)
   12. Update the SearchCustomColumnIds type to include the merchant custom column values - [src/components/Search/types.ts](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/5b76720d5ea5688d48489d535f8b8f826afde05d/src/components/Search/types.ts#L117-L122)

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @mountiny</details>

body:
If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** v9.3.7-3
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/80120
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** agexptest+pr220126g@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Samsung S23FE/ Android 16, iPhone 13 Mini/ iOS 26.1
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Preparation (on Web):
1. Navigate to https://staging.expensify.com/
2. Log in with a new Gmail account
3. Complete the onboarding and go back to OD
4. Go to expenses and scan any valid receipt

Steps: 
1. Launch the Expensify app
2. Log in using the previously created account
3. Go to ND
4. Go to Reports > Expenses
5. Tap on the "View" action on the expense

## Expected Result:
The expense details open in an RHP with the report set to Self DM.

## Actual Result:
An empty expense details screen is briefly displayed when opening the expense for the first time.

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [x] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [x] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] Windows: Chrome
- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Screenshots/Videos

If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.6-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176687/test-cases/41236712 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+hb+2101c@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** iphone promax 13, IOS 26.2 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Preconditions Use only expensifail account and don't use gmail account Create an Workspace and 4 accounts are needed for this TC: Account A: Workspace owner Account B: Workspace approver Account C: Vacation delegate As workspace owner [Account A], invite Account B,C,D to the workspace As workspace owner [Account A] set Account B as approver Account D: Workspace submitter As Workspace approver [Account B] select Account C for Vacation Delegate Account D submitted an expense to the Workspace chat ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. [Account C] logged in on hybrid app 3. Navigate to the expense report >> open the expense detail 4. Tap "More" 5. Select "Split" >>Tap "Save" 6. Long Tap one of the split expense and mark it as "Hold" expense 7. Tap "Approve" button and select "Approve only x.xx" button ## Expected Result: The "From" link should be consistently embedded in the approved expense across both hybrid app and web. ## Actual Result: â€¢ The unhealed expense approve has no embedded "From" link in the hybrid app. â€¢ On the web browser, the "From" link is correctly displayed. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7dc4c9d8-e5a9-4135-bce0-bb1f9715afb0 ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/87fdc9c3-be0e-4bd4-9b62-c4ed69698d36) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

App is closed after pressing back button

Sign in to staging.new.expensify.com with the copilot account 2. Navigate to account settings > two arrows (to change to the main account) 3. With the main account opened as the copilot account, navigate to personal conversation (Your space) 4. Create an expense (track an expense) with the category field empty ## Expected Result: In the conversation the tracked expense is created and a concierge message is displayed to categorize the expense. The message is displayed with "Concierge" as the message header. ## Actual Result: Concierge message is displayed as if it is sent from the copilot account with the copilot header displayed on the message. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ee6ed319-e53b-4ed3-bb87-f0b94fb9b538 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$375] [Onyx] Investigate Reassure stability on CI

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C01GTK53T8Q/p1769093035654139?thread_ts=1768666683.491279&cid=C01GTK53T8Q). Looks like Reassure started to fail again on CI. Here's a [example PR](https://github.com/Expensify/react-native-onyx/pull/722). From our initial tests this flakiness is present on CI but not locally. We suspect that it started to fail after [this PR](https://github.com/Expensify/react-native-onyx/pull/689) was merged. I think we shouldn't focus on reverting changes of the PR but instead try to understand why this is happening and come up with a solution stabilize Reassure again on Onyx.
